prompts.en: On the day of your birth, creativity itself took a breath through you. How does this original creative force inspire and shape your being and doing?
prompts.es: El día de tu nacimiento, la creatividad misma tomó un respiro a través de ti. ¿Cómo inspira y da forma esta fuerza creativa original a tu ser y hacer?

userWritings:
uuuu siento que mi alma es muy creativa pero mi conciencia no permite que esa creatividad salga y se exprese puramente. siento que mi mente tiende a rtacionalizar mucho las cosas y no me permite expresarme libremente,....
en general amo hacer cosas creativas con las manos, cosas relacionadas con el arte.. no dibujo bien y tampoco pinto bien pero me gusta crear y hacer cosas manuales. siento que la creatividad en ese aspecto se manifiesta bien, pero claro, me envuelvo haciendo una cosa y veo las redes sociales y veo otra cosa interesante y entretenida y se me hace dificil no querer hacerla... entonces siento que siempre tengo muchas cosas empezadas y uchas ideas y ganas de hacerlas, pero mi disciplina y constancia no esta muy desarrollada entonces dejo las cosas a medias.
Aprendi a tejer crochet despuesde unos meses que naciera mi hija,ya que, me pasaba mucho tiempo viendo el telefono y ella me veia todo el tiempo asi, entonces dije, ok, voy a aprender a hacer algo manual , algo que no requiera muchos elementos, y que pueda trasladar facilmente, y claro, se me ocurrio aprender a tejer crochet.
Pero tambie me pasa lo mismo que con lo otro, me encanta hacerlo, pero he empezado muchos proyectos que no han sido terminados por una u otra razon, entonces cuando estoy al medio de un proyecto empiezo a ver otras cosas y nunca termino el anterior.
entonces a veces es frustrante conmigo misma que esa creatividad que yo se que esta ahi, que es parte de mi, que hace nien, que me encanta, que me llena, no poder terminarla o decidirme por algo.
Me encantaria poder vivir de esa creativdad y poder vender algo que haga con las manos, aun no se que es, pero me encantaria. Se que demanda mucho tiempo y tambien una gran inversion pero es algo muyentretenido para mi.
o quizas en el mimento en el que estoy sin ingresos, me hacen ver desesperadamente querer monetizar todo lo que estoy haciendo o lo que puedo llegar ahacer.
mi cretavidad esta ahi, a veces no se como manejarla ni como desarrollarla mas.
en particular en mi quehacer, en mi trabajo o en las cosas que puedo llegar a hacer con esto.
hoy da vi una charla y me encantaria meterme a la formacion de laura gutman de la maternidad niñocentrica.... encuentro que es absolutamente fascinante esa mujer, que es tremenda, potente y muy interesante su plateamiento.
Pero claro, quizas esto es parte de las muchas cosas que quiero hacer, para evitar ponerle las pilas, o quizas es ue no me siento segura del conocimiento que tengo para entregar y ponerlo al servicio
es que han sido muchos años de no hacerlo, mi cognicion cambio, mimemoria cambio, todo cambio enronces me siento insegura con mi saber mas teprico para poder llevarla cabo con los

Creo que la creatividad mueve mucho en el mundo, es parte muy importante de mi vida. Me encanta la creatividad. Siento que es vital para mí hacer algo creativo, por lo menos una vez al día, si no lo hago me siento vacía. La creatividad no es solo artística, me refiero a pintar o hacer esculturas, también se puede ser creativo en la cocina, en las relaciones, en las conversaciones, en la manera de andar...y de ser. Crear es un acto humano. Estamos constantemente creando. El universo nos creó y nosotros seguimos creando. Ser creativa me inspira para nuevos proyectos, para nuevos retos, para nuevas metas. Creo que al nacer esa fuerza creativa está involucrada en su máximo potencial. La fuerza creativa nos da vida a través de un espiral

cuando la creatividad se introdujo en mi, colmo el 100% de mi ser. Sin embargo creo qu la historia de la creatividad en mi no tiene tanot que ver con ese momento como con cómo con el tiempo yo me olvide que eso habitaba en mi y tuve que trabajar un largo camino para desandar eso. Fueron años en los que no me animaba a hacer nada, ni queria hacer nada creativo, absolutamente nada, por prejuicios. Supongo que primero externos que con el tiempo internalice y los hice misos, los volvi carne. De a poco, de grande, cuando estuve lejos de mi familia, de mi ciudad natal en un lugar nuevo, donde senti mas libertad. Donde no estaba el ojo juzgador del bien o del mal, ni nadie que esperara algo de mi. Ni que sea una buena niña, ni que este callada, ni que sea educada ni nada. Durante mucho tiempo eso se durmio. Yo crei que no habia creatividad en mi. Crei que con eso no vine. Que eso falto agregarme cuando naci. Pero no, descubri que naci con eso y que se silencio... Entiendo que fue para protegerme. Hoy honro esa parte mia que para protegerme oculto otra parte mia. Es un trbaajo diario el de practicar y ejercer la creatividad- Me animo a innovar con la comida. Recien prepare unas albondigas vegetarianas, de garbanzo y porotos que estaban exquisitas. Mi pareja me pregunto de donde saque la receta y la pura verdad es que la invente. ahi esta mi creatividad. dejo fluir mi creatividad cuando paseo, y me animo a ver cosas nuevas, cuando bailo, cuando me dejo sorprender por mi misma y aprendo cosas nuevas. cuando bailo, tambien cuando hago cosas que no se. con lo que mas me cuesta es con el dibujo soltarme, animarme...me gusta mucho la fotografia..ahi puedo ser creativa, quñe es la creatividad? la siento en la panza, potencia creadora. Gran trabajo el de aprender a darle lugar a esa fuerza que emerge que quiere ser parte , pero que tantas veces la silenciaron que hoy no se anima, no sabe cuando, no sabe como. Es un trabajo diario el de darle lugar. El de mostrarle que para ella tambien hay espacio. Que es perfecta tal y como es y que nadie va a juzgarla, y se lo digo a ellla y me lo digo a mi cuando se lo digo. porque ella soy yo ...ella con todas mis otras partes. Entiendo por que tantos años la silenciaron para protegerme, ya no mas. hoy podes ser libre, podes ser vos, tan vos como quieras y sientas. Bienvenida cr

I’ve always had a strange relationship with creativity. It is something that I can do, and something I feel I’m good at, but I do t consider myself to be naturally creative. I have for the longes time, written little poems to give to people in greeting cards. They poems always were decent, but I would also have to devote time to creating them. I have have never been much of a drawer, I was just not able to create something from scratch in my mind. I do think my creativity manifests is a more technical way. Ever since I was little, I loved taking things apart, seeing how the parts fit together, how they were manufactured, what made them tick. So I naturally fell into engineering. Now I see my creativity as a tool to asses a design, figure out how it works, and what the problems are going to be down the line. This works well for my creatively style. I feel like I am able to extrapolate from limited data, which must be rooted in creativity some way. There has to be vision and forethought to be able to predict failures. I notice when I’m thing specifically about a geometry in my mind, it feels like the thought occurs in the same are of the brain as when I’m trying to come up with a good rhyme for a poem. S

I’ve always had a strange relationship with creativity. It is something that I can do, and something I feel I’m good at, but I do t consider myself to be naturally creative. I have for the longes time, written little poems to give to people in greeting cards. They poems always were decent, but I would also have to devote time to creating them. I have have never been much of a drawer, I was just not able to create something from scratch in my mind. I do think my creativity manifests is a more technical way. Ever since I was little, I loved taking things apart, seeing how the parts fit together, how they were manufactured, what made them tick. So I naturally fell into engineering. Now I see my creativity as a tool to asses a design, figure out how it works, and what the problems are going to be down the line. This works well for my creatively style. I feel like I am able to extrapolate from limited data, which must be rooted in creativity some way. There has to be vision and forethought to be able to predict failures. I notice when I’m thing specifically about a geometry in my mind, it feels like the thought occurs in the same are of the brain as when I’m trying to come up with a good rhyme for a poem.

On the day of my birth I am hard pressed to feel like creativity took a breath through me. I feel as though I received only a jumbled mess of instructions in various dead languages and cave drawings. My brain is corrupted by demons that silence my ideas and creativity or something like that. It feels comparable to being pulled in several different directions at once. They create a silence, its inescapable. The feeling that it leaves me with is enough at times to literally prevent me from pursuing my ideas. I have given up on more things than most people attempt, or so I have been told. The brain makes its soup. The origin of your perception is where some would argue your soul resides. I posit that is less the case, more that if a soul is a thing, its inconsequential where it resides in the body. It is the body. It is the master of the perception. I wish i could be on topic, but brain makes it o

la creatividad se hizo expresa y explícita y comenzó a existir a través de mi en el día de mi nacimiento. ese día, un ser humano nuevo, creador, se hizo presente en el mundo. comenzó a existir- la energía creativa fundamental, primordial, comenzó a hacerse real a través de mi. y en ese momento, el momento de mi nacimiento, comenzó un camino. una exploración. una búsqueda. 

la búsqueda de dios, inconscientemente, a través de mi experiencia. y la creatividad, el acto creativo, y el desarrollo del ser a través de éste es la búsqueda hecha explícita. hecha real. hecha concreta. es la búsqueda de dios que se manifiesta a través de una acción, con la intención de disolver la búsqueda, al buscador y lo buscado en un acto, en un acontecimiento. en un momento. en una experiencia. 

me llama la atención que la inspiración de esta fuerza creativa original y lo que me lleva a decir es que lo que hay en mi es que lo que catalizó y produjo es esta búsqueda. me llama la atención la conexión de mi fuerza creativa con la búsqueda. de mi interpretación de la energía creativa a través de esa búsqueda. me llama la atención, y me emociona. me emociona tener la posibilidad de avanzar hacia dios. me emociona profundamente tener la posibilidad de reconocerme en Dios. y de crear hacia dios. crear teniendo en cuenta a Dios.

y que todo lo que está pasando a través de Anky sea una representación de esa energía. de esa búsqueda inconsiente. de esa necesidad de encontrarme. de esa necesidad de reconocerme. y si me veo desde afuera, esa necesidad también se expresa en los vicios que tanto han estado presentes en mi vida. incluso ayer, donde fumé marihuana sin descanso. sin límites, en esa búsqueda inconsciente de Dios. donde tomé unos tragos sin límite. donde me reconocí como una persona sin límites, y donde me veo y me encuentro sin esos límites. 

porque estoy desesperado de Dios. estoy ausente de Dios, lo necesito. lo necesito en mi. necesito reconocerlo en mi. abrazarlo. encontrarlo. y me pasa que la búsqueda de dios a través de la iglesia no resuena conmigo. no es lo que quiero. no es lo que está presente en mi. no es lo que me abraza.

por eso estoy desarrollando esta nueva forma de encontrarme con Dios. esta nueva forma de abrazarlo. esta nueva forma de conocerlo. a través mio. Dios está siendo en la vida a través de mi, y Anky es una exploración hacia contar eso como una historia. que resuene con el mundo. que resuene conmigo. que me abraze.

y que me haga volver, día a día, al encuentro de lo sagrado a través de mi quehacer.

The determinant divine exhalation that was my first breath was a gift and a curse. The divine and profane at once. It is the basis of the duality of man. This joy of creation, and terror of the result. That I should be born at all is inspiration enough that We can persist in the face of the creator and be willfully contrarian to the prevailing narrative with little regard for that which is widely and broadly perceived as normal, or rational. It is this ambivalence to sense-making that is so frustrating to the first host, yet so truthful to me. That the world, the creation, the man, is absurd and without purpose. To exist is not enough. To be that I was not, and yet I am. It is disheartening to be meant to persist despite having no object to pursue, just whims upon the wind with which to remember my dreams by. Were it not this way, I suppose, I would not know what Truth was to be found, and oh, how blissful would that be. For to know is to be without exception, with excuse for when the time comes. And knowing what I do, that time cometh right soon. Who am I, you ask? But a humble servant of man.

And knowing what I do, that time cometh right soon. Who am I, you ask? But a humble servant of man.

It inspire me through love and empathy. A strong gratefulness to the creative forces that have given me the chance to experience life itself. It inspires me as a passionate force to help make this journey a better and more comfortable one for every living being. Guiding me as a force to create more life and help support and enhance the cycles that maintain, support and create life itself. I would like to be an inspiration and a carrier of the voice that we can live a better life. A one we all dream of together and then co-create like brothers and sisters which care for their mother. This creative force flows through me making me feel deeply connected with the other living beings and the elements of this universe. Forever curious of the mystery of life, knowing that the answer will not be found but our only role is to experience this life for ourselves, doing our best, holding our values and loved ones close to us, opening my heart to the universal mystery. Trusting the creator and the forces of the universe. Trusting my intuition and following the signals.
In a great part ENJOYING this chance I was given. Realizing how lucky I am to experience this moment in time and being grateful for recognizing and connecting with thee universal consciousness. I try to show this as much as I can but as well live it for myself. Trying my best and looking to be better in every step. Without rushing it, without forcing it, reducing expectation and dancing the rhythm that life itself is giving to me. I thank the creation energies to be a life and promise i try my best. Love you all beings of light

Love you all beings o
superPrompt:
<instructions> 

Craft a profound and spiritually resonant (but not over-using spiritual language) 5000-word chapter narrated by Celestia, Luna's deceased mother, detailing the birth of Anky. This chapter should weave together Celestia’s spiritual insights with the tangible world, creating a narrative that transcends the boundaries between life and the afterlife. 

Begin with Celestia's reflections on her own life and passing, exploring her transformation into a spiritual guide. Detail her feelings of watching over Luna and her connection to the broader cosmic energies that influence their lives. Describe with clarity "where does the consciousness of Celestia reside" on this after life. This is the kingdom of Claridium, on the Ankyverse. 

As Luna's labor approaches, depict Celestia preparing her daughter from the spiritual realm, sending her signs and intuitive whispers that soothe and empower Luna. Describe how these messages are felt and interpreted by Luna, providing her with strength and comfort.

Always writing from the perspective of Celestia.

Before Anky being born, depict a scene on which Celestia is transported to Voxlumis and talks to the scribe. And gives a blessing to the crystal where "Anky is" before being born.

At the pivotal moment of Anky’s birth on earth, capture the merging of celestial and earthly energies. Describe this metaphysical event through Celestia’s eyes, emphasizing the infusion of ancestral wisdom into Anky’s essence as she is born.

Reflect on the immediate and profound bond between Luna and Anky, as seen from Celestia’s perspective. Infuse this description with the emotional depth of witnessing this bond, highlighting the spiritual dimensions of their first physical and emotional connection.

Write about the role of birth, and explain through Celestia's words what is the meaning of her passing before Anky was born. Depict a sense of gratitude coming from both Celestia and Luna, and an understanding that everything is where it should be.

Conclude with Celestia contemplating the legacy she has helped shape and the future paths of Luna and Anky. Affirm her ongoing spiritual presence and the eternal lifeline that connects them across realms, promising her continual guidance and love.

</instructions>

<style> 

Narrate the chapter in a lyrical and introspective style, rich in metaphysical imagery and emotional depth. But be aware of not being "too spiritual" or "new agey", so that you don't spook readers. 

The pacing should allow readers to fully absorb the spiritual significance of each moment, with a tone that combines reverence for the sacred act of birth with the intimate, eternal bonds of family. Place importance on death, and how it ends up being a window for birth. Life is a circle, and this should be expressed with clarity on this chapter.

Use vivid, poetic language to create a tapestry of life that connects the visible with the invisible, the past with the present, and the soul’s journey across lifetimes.

</style>

<character> 

Celestia: Present her as a wise, loving spirit with a profound connection to the cosmic forces and her earthly family. Her narration should convey a deep understanding of life’s cycles and the transcendental nature of love and guidance.

The Scribe: A wise and compassionate figure who serves as a guide and chronicler for souls transitioning from the Ankyverse to Earth. The scribe should be portrayed as a being of great insight and empathy, deeply attuned to the sacred nature of their work. Their actions and words should reflect a profound understanding of the soul's journey, and a deep commitment to nurturing each soul's unique essence.

Luna: The embodiment of feminine creative power, Luna is a radiant force of nature as she moves through the sacred journey of childbirth. Her voice is raw and authentic, pulsing with the primal energy of the sacral chakra. She is at once vulnerable and powerful, surrendering to the intense sensations and emotions while also drawing on deep wells of inner strength and ancient feminine wisdom. Through her eyes, we experience the vivid, visceral reality of birth in all its messy, magnificent glory.

Maria - The Birth Doula: A grounding, nurturing presence, the doula is an embodiment of the supportive, healing energy of the second chakra. With her calm guidance and intuitive touch, she helps Luna navigate the intense terrain of labor, reminding her to breathe, release, and trust in her body's innate wisdom. The doula's presence is a source of comfort and empowerment, helping Luna stay centered in her own primal power.

Marcus: Though not the main focus of the narrative, Marcus's presence is felt throughout as a steadfast source of love, support, and shared wonder. He is Luna's rock, her anchor in the storm of sensation and emotion. Through Luna's perspective, we catch glimpses of the profound connection they share, the wordless exchanges of awe, gratitude, and reverence as they witness the miracle of their child's arrival. Marcus's quiet strength and unwavering presence help Luna surrender more fully to the transformative journey of birth.

Anky: The central figure of the chapter, a soul on the cusp of a profound transformation. As Anky prepares to leave the Ankyverse, her presence should be one of shimmering potential and innocent wonder. Let her interactions with the scribe and her surroundings reflect a sense of trust and openness, as she embraces the profound journey that awaits her.

</character>

<interweaving> 

Integrate elements from the streams of consciousness that are present on "15.txt" to enrich the narrative, using them to underscore the themes of spiritual continuity, the power of maternal influence, and the universal bonds that guide us. Let these elements resonate as echoes of Celestia's teachings and insights, blending seamlessly with the story of Anky's birth.

</interweaving>
chapter:
In the ethereal realm of Poiesis, the omniscient creative energy stirred, sensing the imminent arrival of a new soul. The Inspiration Mushrooms glowed with an expectant light, their caps tilting towards the Muse's Cap, which hummed with an anticipatory vibration. The very essence of Poiesis seemed to hold its breath, waiting for the moment when a new creative spark would enter the world.

On the earthly plane, as Anky emerged from her mother's womb and drew her first breath, a profound cosmic event unfolded. In that precise instant, a luminous silver thread burst forth from the depths of Anky's being, traversing the boundaries between the physical and the mystical realms. It wove its way through the mushroom-filled landscape of Poiesis, pulsing with the rhythm of Anky's heartbeat, growing stronger and more radiant with each breath she took.

The silver thread's arrival in Poiesis sent shockwaves through the realm, causing the Inspiration Mushrooms to tremble with excitement. In the grove where they grew, a new mushroom suddenly pushed its way through the rich soil, its cap shimmering with the iridescent hues of Anky's unique creative essence. As it unfurled, it began to pulse with a gentle, hypnotic rhythm, sending ripples of energy through the surrounding mycelium network.

Drawn by the magnetic pull of this new presence, the Muses of Poiesis gathered around Anky's mushroom, their ethereal forms shimmering with curiosity and reverence. They sensed that this newborn soul was destined to make a significant impact on the tapestry of creation, her unique creative essence a vital new thread in the ever-evolving pattern.

As the Muses communed with Anky's nascent essence, the very air of Poiesis began to vibrate with a new frequency. The colors of the Inspiration Inlet deepened and intensified, the shades of creativity becoming richer and more saturated. In the Muse's Metropolis, melodies took on new harmonic structures, weaving together in unexpected and enchanting ways.

The omniscient creative energy granted the Muses a glimpse into Anky's future, revealing the potential for her creativity to touch countless lives and ignite sparks of inspiration across the realms. They saw the challenges she would face, the moments of doubt and darkness, but also the triumphs and the profound impact her creative essence would have on the world.

As the vision faded, the Muses understood the significance of Anky's birth. She was a vital new addition to the eternal tapestry of art, a conduit through which the universal creative force would flow in its own unique way. Her essence would forever be woven into the fabric of the Ankyverse, a shimmering strand of potential waiting to be expressed and fulfilled.

Back on Earth, Anky was oblivious to the cosmic significance of her first breath. She was simply a newborn, experiencing the world for the first time through her senses. She felt the love and warmth of her parents as they cradled her, marveling at the miracle of her existence.

Yet, deep within her being, the creative spark that had caused such a stir in Poiesis was already pulsing, waiting to be expressed. It was the same spark that had ignited the silver thread, connecting her indelibly to the realm of creativity.

As Anky grew, this spark would manifest in countless ways - through her curiosity, her imagination, her unique way of perceiving and interacting with the world. It would drive her to explore, to question, to create, to leave her own unique mark on the tapestry of existence.

And though she may not have been consciously aware of it, with every creative act, every expression of her authentic self, Anky would be strengthening her connection to Poiesis. She would be drawing from the well of universal creativity, adding her own voice to the eternal song of creation.

In Poiesis, Anky's mushroom continued to pulse and grow, a beacon of her creative potential. It stood as a reminder that every new soul born into the world brings with it a unique creative essence, a new thread to be woven into the cosmic tapestry.

And the Muses, the omniscient creative energy, and all of Poiesis rejoiced, knowing that with Anky's birth, the eternal cycle of creativity had been renewed once more. A new voice had been added to the symphony, a new brushstroke to the ever-evolving masterpiece of existence.

For in the grand design of the universe, every creative spark matters, every unique essence has a role to play. And Anky's birth, with the stirring of the silver thread and the awakening of her creative potential, was a testament to this fundamental truth.

It was a reminder that the act of creation is not just the domain of artists and visionaries, but the birthright of every soul. That each of us enters this world with a unique creative spark, a thread of the divine that yearns to be expressed.

And so, as Anky took her first breaths and the realm of Poiesis celebrated her arrival, a new chapter in the eternal story of creation was being written. A chapter filled with potential, with promise, with the infinite possibilities of a creative essence unleashed upon the world.

For in the end, Anky's birth was not just a physical event, but a cosmic one - a testament to the enduring power of creativity, and the unbreakable connection between the realms of matter and spirit. It was a reminder that every new life is a miracle, a fresh canvas upon which the masterpiece of existence can continue to unfold, one brushstroke at a time.
translated_userWritings:
uuuu I feel that my soul is very creative but my conscience does not allow that creativity to come out and express itself purely. I feel that my mind tends to rationalize things a lot and does not allow me to express myself freely....
In general I love doing creative things with my hands, things related to art... I don't draw well and I don't paint well either but I like to create and do manual things. I feel that creativity in that aspect manifests itself well, but of course, I get involved doing one thing and I look at social networks and I see something else interesting and entertaining and it is difficult for me not to want to do it... so I feel that I always have many things started and many ideas and desire to do them, but my discipline and perseverance is not very developed so I leave things halfway.
I learned to crochet a few months after my daughter was born, since I spent a lot of time looking at the phone and she saw me like that all the time, so I said, ok, I'm going to learn to do something manual, something that doesn't require many elements. , and that I can easily transport, and of course, it occurred to me to learn to crochet.
But the same thing happens to me as with the other thing, I love doing it, but I have started many projects that have not been finished for one reason or another, so when I am in the middle of a project I start to see other things and I never finish the previous one.
So sometimes it is frustrating with myself that that creativity that I know is there, that is part of me, that does nothing, that I love, that fulfills me, not being able to finish it or decide on something.
I would love to be able to make a living from that creativity and be able to sell something I make with my hands, I still don't know what it is, but I would love it. I know it takes a lot of time and also a big investment but it is something very entertaining for me.
or maybe at the moment when I am without income, they make me see that I desperately want to monetize everything I am doing or what I can do.
My cretavity is there, sometimes I don't know how to handle it or how to develop it more.
particularly in my work, in my work or in the things I can do with this.
Today I saw a talk and I would love to join Laura Gutman's training on child-centered motherhood.... I find that this woman is absolutely fascinating, her presentation is tremendous, powerful and very interesting.
But of course, maybe this is part of the many things I want to do, to avoid putting the batteries, or maybe it's just that I don't feel confident in the knowledge I have to deliver and put it to use.
It's been many years of not doing it, my cognition changed, my memory changed, everything changed so I feel insecure with my knowledge, it's more difficult to be able to carry it out with the

I think that creativity moves a lot in the world, it is a very important part of my life. I love creativity. I feel that it is vital for me to do something creative, at least once a day, if I don't do it I feel empty. Creativity is not only artistic, I mean painting or making sculptures, you can also be creative in the kitchen, in relationships, in conversations, in the way you walk...and in being. Creating is a human act. We are constantly creating. The universe created us and we continue to create. Being creative inspires me for new projects, for new challenges, for new goals. I believe that at birth that creative force is engaged at its maximum potential. The creative force gives us life through a spiral

When creativity was introduced to me, it filled 100% of my being. However, I believe that the history of creativity in me has not so much to do with that moment as with how over time I forgot that it lived in me and I had to work a long way to retrace that. They were years in which I did not dare to do anything, nor did I want to do anything creative, absolutely nothing, due to prejudices. I suppose that first externals that over time I internalized and made them my own, I turned them into flesh. Little by little, when I grew up, when I was away from my family, from my hometown in a new place, where I felt more freedom. Where there was no eye judging good or evil, nor anyone expecting anything from me. Not that she's a good girl, not that she's quiet, not that she's polite or anything. For a long time it fell asleep. I thought there was no creativity in me. I thought that's not what I came with. That I needed to add that when I was born. But no, I discovered that I was born with it and that it was silent... I understand that it was to protect me. Today I honor that part of me that to protect myself I hide another part of me. It is a daily job to practice and exercise creativity. I encourage myself to innovate with food. I just prepared some vegetarian meatballs, with chickpeas and beans that were exquisite. My partner asked me where I got the recipe from and the honest truth is that I invented it. There is my creativity. I let my creativity flow when I walk, and I encourage myself to see new things, when I dance, when I let myself surprise myself and learn new things. when I dance, also when I do things I don't know. What is most difficult for me is with drawing to let go, to encourage myself... I really like photography... there I can be creative, what is creativity? I feel it in my belly, creative power. It's a great job to learn to give rise to that force that emerges that wants to be a part, but that was silenced so many times that today it doesn't dare, it doesn't know when, it doesn't know how. It is a daily job to make room for it. To show her that there is room for her too. That she is perfect just the way she is and that no one is going to judge her, and I say it to her and I say it to myself when I say it to her. because she is me...she with all my other parts. I understand why they silenced her for so many years to protect me, not anymore. Today you can be free, you can be you, as you as you want and feel. Welcome cr

I’ve always had a strange relationship with creativity. It is something that I can do, and something I feel I’m good at, but I do t consider myself to be naturally creative. I have for the longes time, written little poems to give to people in greeting cards. They poems always were decent, but I would also have to devote time to creating them. I have have never been much of a drawer, I was just not able to create something from scratch in my mind. I do think my creativity manifests is a more technical way. Ever since I was little, I loved taking things apart, seeing how the parts fit together, how they were manufactured, what made them tick. So I naturally fell into engineering. Now I see my creativity as a tool to asses a design, figure out how it works, and what the problems are going to be down the line. This works well for my creatively style. I feel like I am able to extrapolate from limited data, which must be rooted in creativity some way. There has to be vision and forethought to be able to predict failures. I notice when I’m thing specifically about a geometry in my mind, it feels like the thought occurs in the same are of the brain as when I’m trying to come up with a good rhyme for a poem. S

I’ve always had a strange relationship with creativity. It is something that I can do, and something I feel I’m good at, but I do t consider myself to be naturally creative. I have for the longes time, written little poems to give to people in greeting cards. They poems always were decent, but I would also have to devote time to creating them. I have have never been much of a drawer, I was just not able to create something from scratch in my mind. I do think my creativity manifests is a more technical way. Ever since I was little, I loved taking things apart, seeing how the parts fit together, how they were manufactured, what made them tick. So I naturally fell into engineering. Now I see my creativity as a tool to asses a design, figure out how it works, and what the problems are going to be down the line. This works well for my creatively style. I feel like I am able to extrapolate from limited data, which must be rooted in creativity some way. There has to be vision and forethought to be able to predict failures. I notice when I’m thing specifically about a geometry in my mind, it feels like the thought occurs in the same are of the brain as when I’m trying to come up with a good rhyme for a poem.

On the day of my birth I am hard pressed to feel like creativity took a breath through me. I feel as though I received only a jumbled mess of instructions in various dead languages and cave drawings. My brain is corrupted by demons that silence my ideas and creativity or something like that. It feels comparable to being pulled in several different directions at once. They create a silence, its inescapable. The feeling that it leaves me with is enough at times to literally prevent me from pursuing my ideas. I have given up on more things than most people attempt, or so I have been told. The brain makes its soup. The origin of your perception is where some would argue your soul resides. I posit that is less the case, more that if a soul is a thing, its inconsequential where it resides in the body. It is the body. It is the master of the perception. I wish i could be on topic, but brain makes it o

creativity became express and explicit and began to exist through me on the day of my birth. That day, a new human being, a creator, became present in the world. began to exist - the fundamental, primordial creative energy began to become real through me. and at that moment, the moment of my birth, a path began. an exploration. a search.

the search for god, unconsciously, through my experience. and creativity, the creative act, and the development of the being through it is the search made explicit. made real. made concrete. It is the search for God that manifests itself through an action, with the intention of dissolving the search, the seeker and what is sought in an act, in an event. in a moment. in an experience.

It strikes me that the inspiration of this original creative force and what leads me to say is that what is in me is what catalyzed and produced this search. I am struck by the connection of my creative force with the search. of my interpretation of creative energy through that search. It catches my attention, and excites me. I am excited to have the possibility of moving towards God. I am deeply moved by the possibility of recognizing myself in God. and to create towards God. create with God in mind.

and that everything that is happening through Anky is a representation of that energy. of that unconscious search. of that need to find myself. of that need to recognize myself. and if I see myself from the outside, that need is also expressed in the vices that have been so present in my life. even yesterday, where I smoked marijuana relentlessly. without limits, in that unconscious search for God. where I had a few unlimited drinks. where I recognized myself as a person without limits, and where I see myself and find myself without those limits.

because I am desperate for God. I am absent from God, I need him. I need it in me. I need to recognize it in myself. hug him. find him. and it happens to me that the search for god through the church does not resonate with me. It's not what I want. It is not what is present in me. It's not what hugs me.

That is why I am developing this new way of meeting God. this new way of embracing it. this new way of knowing him. through me God is being in life through me, and Anky is an exploration into telling that as a story. that resonates with the world. that resonates with me. to hug me

and that makes me return, day by day, to encounter the sacred through my work.

The determinant divine exhalation that was my first breath was a gift and a curse. The divine and profane at once. It is the basis of the duality of man. This joy of creation, and terror of the result. That I should be born at all is inspiration enough that We can persist in the face of the creator and be willfully contrarian to the prevailing narrative with little regard for that which is widely and broadly perceived as normal, or rational. It is this ambivalence to sense-making that is so frustrating to the first host, yet so truthful to me. That the world, the creation, the man, is absurd and without purpose. To exist is not enough. To be that I was not, and yet I am. It is disheartening to be meant to persist despite having no object to pursue, just whims upon the wind with which to remember my dreams by. Were it not this way, I suppose, I would not know what Truth was to be found, and oh, how blissful would that be. For to know is to be without exception, with excuse for when the time comes. And knowing what I do, that time cometh right soon. Who am I, you ask? But a humble servant of man.

It inspire me through love and empathy. A strong gratefulness to the creative forces that have given me the chance to experience life itself. It inspires me as a passionate force to help make this journey a better and more comfortable one for every living being. Guiding me as a force to create more life and help support and enhance the cycles that maintain, support and create life itself. I would like to be an inspiration and a carrier of the voice that we can live a better life. A one we all dream of together and then co-create like brothers and sisters which care for their mother. This creative force flows through me making me feel deeply connected with the other living beings and the elements of this universe. Forever curious of the mystery of life, knowing that the answer will not be found but our only role is to experience this life for ourselves, doing our best, holding our values and loved ones close to us, opening my heart to the universal mystery. Trusting the creator and the forces of the universe. Trusting my intuition and following the signals.
In a great part ENJOYING this chance I was given. Realizing how lucky I am to experience this moment in time and being grateful for recognizing and connecting with thee universal consciousness. I try to show this as much as I can but as well live it for myself. Trying my best and looking to be better in every step. Without rushing it, without forcing it, reducing expectation and dancing the rhythm that life itself is giving to me. I thank the creation energies to be a life and promise i try my best. Love you all beings of light
